Classes in com.mostc.pftt.runner used by com.mostc.pftt.runner
AbstractLocalTestPackRunner
          Dynamic Thread Pooling: dynamically increases and decreases the number of threads used to run tests as slower or faster test are encountered to maximize cpu utilization.
AbstractLocalTestPackRunner.TestCaseGroup
           
AbstractLocalTestPackRunner.TestPackThread
           
AbstractPhptTestCaseRunner
           
AbstractPhptTestCaseRunner2
           
AbstractPhpUnitTestCaseRunner
          runs a single PhpUnitTestCase having PFTT directly run PhpUnit test cases itself, instead of just wrapping `phpunit` allows for: -faster execution (threads) -Web Server support ('cut closer to actual server') -more accurate results -usually only a slight or no difference -but if you care about accurate, quality or thorough testing -or if care about how well your software actually works -better analysis of large amounts of phpunit tests -opcache support -opcache can break reflection (at least on apache) -PFTT doesn't use reflection for phpunit tests so PFTT can run phpunit tests regardless of this problem ->add `phpunit_reflection_only` to your -config to force PFTT to use reflection to test this problem -counting additional statuses (ex: xskip) -accurate CRASH and TIMEOUT detection
AbstractTestCaseRunner
           
AbstractTestPackRunner
           
AbstractTestPackRunner.ETestPackRunnerState
           
AbstractTestPackRunner.SlowReplacementTestPackRunnerThread
           
AbstractTestPackRunner.TestPackRunnerThread
           
HttpPhptTestCaseRunner
          Runs PHPT Test Cases against PHP while its running under a Web Server (builtin, IIS or Apache)
HttpPhpUnitTestCaseRunner

AbstractPhptTestCaseRunner
           
AbstractPhpUnitTestCaseRunner
          runs a single PhpUnitTestCase having PFTT directly run PhpUnit test cases itself, instead of just wrapping `phpunit` allows for: -faster execution (threads) -Web Server support ('cut closer to actual server') -more accurate results -usually only a slight or no difference -but if you care about accurate, quality or thorough testing -or if care about how well your software actually works -better analysis of large amounts of phpunit tests -opcache support -opcache can break reflection (at least on apache) -PFTT doesn't use reflection for phpunit tests so PFTT can run phpunit tests regardless of this problem ->add `phpunit_reflection_only` to your -config to force PFTT to use reflection to test this problem -counting additional statuses (ex: xskip) -accurate CRASH and TIMEOUT detection
